public class DefaultCoreModel
extends DefaultDrawingModel
implements CoreModel, java.io.Serializable

The default drawing implementation.

2.1, 03/2005

Assen Antov

Constructor Detail

DefaultCoreModel

public DefaultCoreModel()
Creates an empty drawing with a layer, named "0" and default linestyle.

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: CoreModel
Initializes the drawing model. Removes all entities; creates a default viewport, styles and layer. The method will fire a CoreModel.EVENT_CLEAR PropertyChangeEvent. No other events will be fired.

Specified by:
clear in interface CoreModel

add

public void add(java.lang.Object element)
Adds an entity to the drawing. Note that:

  • if the entity has no layer set it is added to the current layer;
  • if entity's layer is not defined in the drawing, a default layer with the same name is added to it;
  • entity's color, linestyle and thickness may also be changed depending on the current color, linestyle and thickness of the CoreModel.

The method will fire a PropertyChangeEvent named DrawingModel.EVENT_ADD with the entity set as the new property value.

Specified by:
add in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
add in class DefaultDrawingModel
Parameters:
element - the element to add
Throws:
DrawingModelException - if not an Entity
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the entitiy is null
java.lang.NullPointerException - if entitiy's shape is null

addFeature

public void addFeature(java.lang.Object feature)
Adds a feature to the drawing. The features added must be serializable. See DrawingModel#addFeature(Object) for details.

Specified by:
addFeature in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
addFeature in class DefaultDrawingModel
Parameters:
feature - the feature to add
Throws:
DrawingException - on attempt to add a feature that is not serializable
See Also:
DefaultDrawingModel.getFeature(Class, String)

removeFeature

public void removeFeature(java.lang.Object feature)
Removes a feature from the drawing. The following rules will apply:

  • Layers - the layer named "0" cannot be removed and will always be present. If there are entities in the layer to remove, they will also be removed from the drawing;
  • LineStyles - the linestyle named "Default" cannot be removed;
  • TextStyles - the textstyle named "Default" cannot be removed;

See DrawingModel#removeFeature(Object) for details.

Specified by:
removeFeature in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
removeFeature in class DefaultDrawingModel
Parameters:
feature - the feature to remove
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - on attempt to remove null feature
DrawingException - on attempt to remove a feature that should not be removed or the feature is not added
